content.rendered:
Majestic Kumaon Tour Package

Home » India » Uttarakhand » Majestic Kumaon Tour Package

Tour Overview

The Kumaon hills are referred to as majestic because of the kingly, ostensible affluence of nature’s beauty available in the region. Tourists generally flock in this land to take the pleasure of the floral opulence and the untouched beauty of fauna in the region. They also come here for the snow-peaked mountains and the gurgling sound of rushing water bodies that flow down straight from the Himalayas. This region has definitely something worth boasting in terms of wildlife sanctuaries and national parks which include the world famous Corbett National Park. Right next to the Kumaon region fall Rishikesh and Haridwar, two of the most prominent religious sites for Hindus in India. So, while you are on a tour to Kumaon region you can take short detours to these sites to fulfill your spiritual aspiration. All in all, Kumaon is a must visit the land with lakes and deep forests and serene ambiance that will lure any nature-lover who desires to take pleasure in this beauty.

This tour package form Namaste India-Trip is a good way to explore the undiscovered and unknown hill region of Kumaon lying in the Himalayan region. Our tour packages are most competitive in price with facility for customizing them according to your requirements, especially if you are on a shoe-string budget. We take utmost care of all our customers so that they get back full services in lieu of the investment that they make through bookings. This tour gives you a full tour of the Kumaon region including the Corbett National Park and excursion of places like Ranikhet and Nainital for those in search of adventure. You will also come across the divine temples of ancient origins and sporting arenas like the golf course of this region while completing this tour. Enjoy the chilly air and fresh breath along with the scenic view of the Himalayas without any discomfort through this package of ours.

Majestic Kumaon Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Delhi – Corbett (300kms / 7hrs)

You will be welcomed at the Delhi railway station/airport by our Namaste India Trip representative who will drive you safely to the Corbett National Park. You can stop at the Garjia Devi temple for blessings to move onward safely into the Park. You will check into the hotel here for overnight stay.

Day 2 :In Corbett

Early next morning soon after breakfast you will be provided with jeep-safari at the Corbett National Park. Spend the evening taking rest and the night will be spent at the hotel.

Day 3 :Corbett – Ranikhet

Post breakfast you will drive to Ranikhet or the ‘The Queens Field’ where you will check into a hotel and spend the entire day taking leisurely walks through the town. Overnight stay will be at the hotel here.

Day 4 :Ranikhet – Kausani

After your breakfast is over you can proceed for sight-seeing which will include Jhoola Devi, Chaubatia, Kalika and Upat (golf courses) and Ram Mandir. Later on, you can drive up to Kausani, nature’s own reserve, to spend some quiet time with nature capturing the exotic view of the Himalayas. Spend the night at a hotel in Kausani.

Day 5 :Kausani – Baijnath

Start the day with the sunrise view through the Himalayas. Return to the hotel and after breakfast, you can visit the Bajinath Temple and the small, ancient town famed for magnificent Parvati (Hindu Goddess) stone idol. Get back to Kausani for spending the night here.

Day 6 :Kausani – Nainital

Post breakfast on day 6 you will leave for Nainital. Spend the entire day strolling across the Mall Road and shopping for wax candles which are pretty famous here. You can also consider a Naini Lake boat ride at your expense here. Spend the night in the hotel here.

Day 7 :In Nainital

Finish your breakfast and spend day 7 in exploring the hills of Nainital. The scenic beauty of various natural resources is worth the watch. Visit the various lakes like Sat Tal, Bhim Tal, and Naukuchia among others. You are to stay overnight at the hotel in Nainital.

Day 8 :Nainital – Delhi (330 Kms/7hrs)

On the final day, you can enjoy a hearty breakfast after which Namaste India Trip representative will drop you to Delhi railway station/airport through a comfortable drive. Take unforgettable memories back home with you.

Price Details

Tour Name Majestic Kumaon Tour Package
Duration 8 Days / 7 Nights
Destinations Delhi - Corbett - Ranikhet - Nainital
Tour Price On Request

Chat with specialist who can help plan your tour!

  • +91-971 1616 316

    Holiday Your Way with Namaste India Trip!

    Filling out the information form provided allows you to receive the best budget-friendly customized itinerary in just a few hours.

    • We assure the privacy of your contact data.

    • This data will only be used by our team to contact you and no other purposes.

    Trip Highlights

    • Visit to the Jim Corbett National Park
    • Be a part of nature at Ranikhet ‘The Queen of Fields’
    • Get some divine blessings at the Baijnath Temple
    • A sail through the Shimla lakes Sat Tal, Bhimtal, and Naukuchia

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs for Majestic Kumaon Tour Package

    Q. When Is The Best Season To Visit Kumaon?

    A. Because the weather is mostly clear and the temperatures are mild, the months of March-April and September-October are ideal for adventure activities such as trekking and paragliding.

    Q. What Are The Names Of The Lakes In The Kumaon Region?

    A. People come here for yachting and boating, and it is a popular tourist destination. Sattal is a collection of seven lakes, which include Hanuman Lake, Ram Lake, Sita Lake, Lakshman Lake, Bharat Lake, Garuda Lake, and Nal Damyanti Lake.

    Q. Which Hill Station Is Encircled By The Kumaon Hills?

    A. Nainital, also known as the "lake district," is surrounded by Kumaon Mountains.

    Q. Which City Is Known As The Kumaon Gateway?

    A. The Kathgodam neighborhood of Haldwani is known as the "Gateway to Kumaon" because it is located in the immediate foothills of the Kumaon Himalayas.

    Q. Which Is Uttarakhand's Highest Lake?

    A. Roopkund Lake is known as the Mysterious Lake. The highest lake in Uttarakhand is also one of the most difficult treks in the Indian subcontinent. Roopkund is located in a remote area of Chamoli district, near Trishul Peak.
